subject: Web3
title: How NFTs Work Technically
description: A quick win: understand How NFTs Work Technically.

hook.text: An NFT is a smart contract on a blockchain. It points to a file and records who owns it.

buildup.text: Most NFTs use the ERC-721 standard on Ethereum. Each token has a unique ID and a metadata link.

discovery.text: The image or video usually isn't stored on the blockchain. It lives on a server or IPFS, a decentralized storage system.

twist.text: If the server hosting the file goes down, the NFT still exists â€” but it points to nothing. A broken link.

climax.text: This is why serious projects use IPFS or Arweave for permanent storage. The chain records ownership; storage holds content.

punchline.text: The NFT is the receipt. The file lives somewhere else entirely.

quiz.question: Where is an NFT's image typically stored?
options: On an external server or decentralized storage like IPFS
